By Poincaré duality, for i\neq N, \operatorname {H}^i(Y,\mathbb {C}) can thus be calculated from \operatorname {H}^\bullet (X,\mathbb {C}). Set \begin {aligned} \operatorname {H}_\mathrm {ev}^N(Y,\mathbb {C}) &= \operatorname {Ker}(\operatorname {H}^N(Y,\mathbb {C})\to \operatorname {H}^{N+2}(X,\mathbb {C})) \\&= \text {orthogonal complement of }\operatorname {H}^N(X,\mathbb {C})\hookrightarrow \operatorname {H}^N(Y,\mathbb {C}) \end {aligned} (the evanescent part of the cohomology). We have that \operatorname {H}^N(Y,\mathbb {C}) = \operatorname {H}_\mathrm {ev}^N(Y,\mathbb {C})\oplus \operatorname {H}^N(X,\mathbb {C}) and we thus obtain a lot of information about the Hodge structure of \operatorname {H}^\bullet (Y,\mathbb {C}) when we know about that of \operatorname {H}^\bullet (X,\mathbb {C}) and the Hodge filtration of \operatorname {H}^{N+1}(U,\mathbb {C}).
